title: Native Vulkan support for WPF
body: Because Microsoft will not develop DirectX for Windows 7, its latest desktop OS version since Windows 8.x and 10 are a mobile and limited OS (also ugly), they are not desktop operating systems, Microsoft should support Vulkan in WPF that runs on any version of Windows, including Windows 7 which has the largest market share and installed base, without the need or obligation to update an operating system that nobody wants.

comments.body: The problem I see is that Vulkan requires relatively new graphics hardware, AFAIK it's not even supported on Intel Graphics older than Skylake (which is important since many business laptops don't have dedicated GPUs, and most of them are not Skylake or newer yet). Plus, Windows 7 is already in extended support, and its less than three years before it's out of support.
